docs.title: Short bio
docs.text: I am an applied ML researcher and team leader, with experience in deep learning, federated learning, and biomedical applications thereof. More recently, I also started working with LLMs.

docs.title: Professional experience
docs.text:
• 2024-Now: Core team researcher at H
  • 2021-2024: Group lead at Owkin, first on federated learning, then fundamental ML
  • 2018-2021: Senior data scientist at Owkin, with a focus on federated learning

docs.title: Education
docs.text:
• 2015-2018: PhD in ML at ENS Paris under the supervision of Stéphane Mallat
  • 2014-2015: Master MVA in Maths, Computer Vision, and Machine Learning, ENS cachan.
  • 2011-2014: Engineering degree at Ecole polytechnique. Majored in Applied Mathematics

docs.title: Research
docs.text: I have experience in conducting applied research in machine learning, and also using machine learning for other fields of research, especially biomedical applications, both as a first author and also as a scientific lead. I also regularly review papers for open access conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS...).

docs.title: PyDESeq2
docs.text: PyDESeq2 is a python implementation of the DESeq2 method for differential expression analysis (DEA) with bulk RNA-seq data. I supervised the project and took part in code reviews.

docs.title: Substra
docs.text: Substra is an open source federated learning (FL) software that was developed by Owkin to enable secure collaborations across hospitals and pharmaceutical companies. While I did not contribute to the substra core, I worked on an internal FL library that led to the current SubstraFL component, which provides high-level abstractions that are more amenable to ML practitioners.

docs.title: Kymatio
docs.text: Kymatio is an implementation of the wavelet scattering transform in Python that efficiently leverages GPUs. I have primarily contributed to the 1D initial implementation of kymatio, as a byproduct of my PhD.

docs.title: Teaching
docs.text:
During my PhD, I was fortunate to be a teaching assistant for the following organizations:

  • 2017-2018: Co-organizer of the 3rd edition of the Challenge Data
  • 2016-2017: Main organizer of Challenge Data, a kaggle-style competition with problems brought by private companies
  • Spring 2017: Teaching assistant in signal processing at ENS Paris
  • 2015-2016: Teaching assistant in mathematics and computer science for the Frontières du Vivant Bachelor program
